intro: Mastixia trichophylla, commonly known as the silky mastix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round, and turn red when mature, containing a single seed. Mastixia trichophylla is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
